intro: Trixis californica var. californica, commonly known as the California trixis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in coastal and inland regions of California. It produces small white to greenish flowers and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. The species is known for its resilience to drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
